description: From Latin discrepāns, present participle of discrepō (“to differ in sound, differ, disagree”), from dis- (“apart”) + crepō (“to make a noise, crackle”).

adjectives.description: discrepant (comparative more discrepant, superlative most discrepant)

examples: The Egyptians were doubtless the most singular of all the Pagans, and the most oddly discrepant from the rest in their manner of worship; yet nevertheless, that these also agreed with the rest in those fundamentals of worshipping one supreme and universal Numen  […]
If you persecute heretics or discrepants, they unite themselves as to a common defence  […]
